answers.answer: Are you sure its not the baby kicking your ribs? That hurts so bad!!

I have no idea she is so big now that she seems like she can hit the top and bottom but right after I had that pain she wasn't moving at all and then started moving about 1/2 hour later. I thought maybe it was her kicking my rib but I figured I would feel her move.

I remember when I was pregnant Evan was always in my ribs, but I didnt necessarily feel the rest of his body move. It was probably her in your ribs. If it happens again, push down a little on the top of your belly, if it goes away, you know it was her.
Lol will do little stinker is probably in there playing games!
yup thats what they do! Just wait until she comes out and its 2 AM, and all you want is for her to go to sleep, and shes laying there laughing!!!! You can't help but laugh!!!
have you had a very bad headache, nausea, vomiting, flashing lights or seeing spots in front of your eyes??

I have had bad headaches, nausea sometimes, no vomiting, flashing lights and seeing spots sometimes when I get up too fast or am trapped in a room I feel light headed. But my doctor said that is because I'm low on iron. Why do you think it could be what caused that?
sometimes these symptoms can be a sign of pre-eclampsia, how is your blood pressure?
or it could just be your baby, or just growing pains..
Umm... normal maybe a little high but not anything like extremely high.
I just looked up preeclampsia online and I definatly dont have any of the real symptoms like fast weight gain or bloating so I doubt it could be that.

Mine hurts too.  It feels like my ribs and sternum are bruised.  I think for me it is because my uterus is growing more and my ribs are expanding to allow space.  Sometimes when I have a few BH contractions it is also sore.
I have no idea what a BH is supposed to feel like but gosh I have been wondering. I should be having them by now shouldn't I?
You could be having them and just not feeling them. When your stomach gets really hard, thats them.

I'm almost 34 weeks and I've had bad rib pain (the same bruised feeling) high up on the right side for weeks, this week I found out that my baby hasn't turned head down yet, so it's his head up under there! It's agony if I lie for any length of time on my right side.Ruth xx

I can't tell when my stomach gets hard... is that weird?Oh Ruth that must be hard... I honestly couldn't even imagine having to deal with that feeling all the time. Hopefully your baby will turn soon!
So do I!!Good luck to you, and I hope you don't get it again, it's not nice.Ruth xx

question: I just wanted to know if it was normal to experiance a sharp pain at the very top of your belly right underneath your boobs. I woke up this morning thinking someone had stabbed me it hurt so bad. It ended up going away about a minute later and hasn't happened since but basically I just want to know if that is normal.
title: 29 Weeks and pain on top of belly
